message:
SYSTEM: 01.03_NonStandardOWLReasoning_ModularisationAndDebugging.pdf: Página 10
10 
Coverage. Formal definition and algorithm 
•  The module Ɛ’ covers the knowledge base Ɛ for the 
specified topic if for all classes A, B built from the 
specified terms: 
if   
 O U Ɛ ╞ A ⊆ B, 
then  
 O U Ɛ’╞ A ⊆ B.  
•  Coverage = preserving entailments (that is, no 
difference between using Ɛ or Ɛ’) 
•  In general, undecidable 
•  Use a syntactic approximation 
•  Fast! 
•  Modules are not minimal in size, but guarantee coverage 
19 
Safety 
•  Goal: Don’t change the meaning of imported terms. 
•  That is, don’t add new knowledge about the imported topic. 
•  e.g., because you are not an expert in this topic 
•  Question: Which axioms are we allowed to write? 
20
speaker: SYSTEM
